decision_conditions: Trees 4 and 6: An application to fell trees covered by a tree preservation order should be accompanied with evidence showing the need for the tree(s) removal.  This should either be a report showing:
a)	that the tree(s) health or structural condition is so poor that pruning or other works can no longer retain the tree(s) in a safe condition.
b)	That the tree has been proven to be causing structural damage.

This requirement is clearly stated on the TPO application form (Section 8).  As this evidence has not been provided with the application, Ealing Council refuses permission to remove the protected tree(s).
Suggest a professional survey is provided by an accredited Arboricultural Consultant to support application.
| Trees 7 & 8:  The proposed works are excessive in nature and go beyond the recommendations of the British Standard 3998, which requires:

"the remaining live crown should make up at least two-thirds of the height of the tree." | Tree 1: Cutting back to the boundary line will go beyond the recommendations set out in British Standard 3998:2010 Tree Work - Recommendations, section 7.7.2.  Healthy and structurally sound trees are capable of tolerating crown reductions of 30% of leaf volume, which is detailed as approximately 12% of branch length (allowing for variation in species).  The proposed works go well beyond this maximum level and as no information has been provided to show special/exceptional reasons (subsidence damage, structural damage to the tree, etc.) for such a level of reduction the works are refused.
description:
TPO 975 - Tree 1 Sycamore - cut back the branches overhanging washing line area of adjoining land to the boundary line 
Tree 4 Sycamore - remove dead / dying tree 
Tree 6 Sycamore - remove dead / dying tree
Trees 7, 8 - Sycamores - Lift crown to 5m
